Fortran, Ada, and Go, as well as libraries for these languages.

dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description: C library for high-throughput sequencing data formats.
dependencies.name: htslib

Perl 5 is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language with over
27 years of development.

dependencies.name: perl-bio-db-hts

dependencies.description: The Ensembl Core Perl API and SQL schema
dependencies.name: perl-bio-ensembl

dependencies.name: perl-bio-ensembl-funcgen

dependencies.description:
BioPerl is the product of a community effort to produce Perl code which
is useful in biology. Examples include Sequence objects, Alignment
objects and database searching objects. These objects not only do what
they are advertised to do in the documentation, but they also interact -
Alignment objects are made from the Sequence objects, Sequence objects
have access to Annotation and SeqFeature objects and databases, Blast
objects can be converted to Alignment objects, and so on. This means
that the objects provide a coordinated and extensible framework to do
computational biology. BioPerl development focuses on Perl classes, or
code that is used to create objects representing biological entities.
There are scripts provided in the scripts/ and examples/ directories but
scripts are not the main focus of the BioPerl developers. Of course, as
the objects do most of the hard work for you, all you have to do is
combine a number of objects together sensibly to make useful scripts.
The intent of the BioPerl development effort is to make reusable tools
that aid people in creating their own sites or job-specific
applications. The BioPerl website at https://bioperl.org/ also attempts
to maintain links and archives of standalone bio-related Perl tools that
are not affiliated or related to the core BioPerl effort. Check the site
for useful code ideas and contribute your own if possible.
dependencies.name: perl-bioperl

dependencies.description: MySQL driver for the Perl5 Database Interface (DBI)
dependencies.name: perl-dbd-mysql

dependencies.description:
The DBI is the standard database interface module for Perl. It defines a
set of methods, variables and conventions that provide a consistent
database interface independent of the actual database being used.
dependencies.name: perl-dbi

dependencies.description: Perl extension to provide a PerlIO layer to gzip/gunzip
dependencies.name: perl-perlio-gzip

dependencies.description:
Set::IntervalTree uses Interval Trees to store and efficiently look up
ranges using a range-based lookup.
dependencies.name: perl-set-intervaltree

dependent_to.description:
Separate installation and management for the Ensembl Variant Effect
Predictor (vep)
dependent_to.name: vep-cache

description:
Ensembl Variant Effect Predictor (VEP) determines the effect of your
variants (SNPs, insertions, deletions, CNVs or structural variants) on
genes, transcripts, and protein sequence, as well as regulatory regions.
(Requires addtional data available via the `vep-cache` package)
name: vep

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
